citation: Department of Health Care Access and Information (HCAI) Annual Financial Disclosure Reports, Pivot Profiles 2009-2013
description: The dataset contains income statement information for all licensed, comparable hospitals in the state of California.  Kaiser hospitals, state mental hospitals, psychiatric health facilities, and hospitals with mainly long-term care patients are excluded.  Deductions from Revenue, Net Patient Revenue, Net from Operations (Operating Revenue less Operating Expense), and Net Income for public hospitals has been adjusted for Disproportionate Share intergovernmental transfers for funding the Disproportionate Share Hospital Program. The program gets federal matching funds to pay supplemental payments to hospitals with a disproportionate share of uninsured, underinsured, and Medi-Cal patients.  To link the OSHPD IDs with those from other Departments, like CDPH, please reference the "Licensed Facility Cross-Walk" Open Data table at https://data.chhs.ca.gov/dataset/licensed-facility-crosswalk.
name: hospital-profitability-2009-2013
related_resources: HCAI Quarterly Financial & Utilization Reports: http://hcai.ca.gov/hid/Products/Hospitals/QuatrlyFinanData/CmpleteData/default  |  HCAI Quarterly Financial & Utilization Reports: http://hcai.ca.gov/hid/Products/Hospitals/QuatrlyFinanData/CmpleteData/default.asp  |  http://hcai.ca.gov/HID/Products/Hospitals/AnnFinanData/   |  http://hcai.ca.gov/HID/Products/Hospitals/AnnFinanData/

resources.description: The dataset contains income statement information for all licensed, comparable hospitals in the state of California.  Kaiser hospitals, state mental hospitals, psychiatric health facilities, and hospitals with mainly long-term care patients are excluded.  Deductions from Revenue, Net Patient Revenue, Net from Operations (Operating Revenue less Operating Expense), and Net Income for public hospitals has been adjusted for Disproportionate Share intergovernmental transfers for funding the Disproportionate Share Hospital Program. The program gets federal matching funds to pay supplemental payments to hospitals with a disproportionate share of uninsured, underinsured, and Medi-Cal patients.
resources.name: hospital-profitability-2009-2013-csv

fields.description: The calendar year in which the reported fiscal year end date falls.
fields.name: Year
fields.title: Year

fields.description: A unique nine-digit identifier assigned to each facility by the Department of Health Care Access and Information (HCAI).  The first three digits indicate the type of facility, the next two digits indicate the county in which the facility is located.  The last four-digits are unique within each county.
fields.name: Facility Number
fields.title: Facility Number

fields.description: The begin date of the hospital’s fiscal reporting period.
fields.name: Begin Date
fields.title: Begin Date

fields.description: The end date of the hospital’s fiscal reporting period.
fields.name: End Date
fields.title: End Date

fields.description: The name of the county where the hospital is located.  Total amounts are listed as Statewide.
fields.name: County Name
fields.title: County Name

fields.description: The type of control (ownership type) of the hospital.
fields.name: Type of Control
fields.title: Type of Control

fields.description:
Description of the income statement item amount.  The item types are:
GR_PT_REV – Gross Routine Patient Revenue
DED_REV_PLUS_DSH – Deductions from Revenue plus Disproportionate Share Intergovernmental Transfer Amount
TOT_CAP_REV – Total Capitation Revenue
NET_REV_LESS_DSH – Net Patient Revenue less Disproportionate Share Intergovernmental Transfer Amount
OTH_OP_REV – Other Operating Revenue
TOT_OP_EXP – Total Operating Expense
NET_OP_LESS_DSH – Net from Operations less Disproportionate Share Intergovernmental Transfer Amount
NONOP_REV – Non-operating Revenue
NONOP_EXP – Non-operating Expense
INC_TAX – Income Tax
EXT_ITEM – Extraordinary Items
NET_INC_LESS_DSH – Net Income less Disproportionate Share Transfer Amount
OPERATING_MARGIN -Net income from operations divided by total operating revenue (net patient revenue plus other operating revenue).  This ratio indicates the percentage of net patient revenue which remains as income after operating expenses.
fields.name: Income Statement Item
fields.title: Income Statement Item

fields.description: The amount reported on the income statement for the item type.
fields.name: Income Statement Amount
fields.title: Income Statement Amount

fields.description: The income statement item amount per adjusted patient day.  Adjusted patient days are calculated using the following formula:  Total gross patient revenue divided by gross inpatient revenue, times the number of patient days.  The purpose of "adjusting" the patient days is to recognize outpatient utilization.
fields.name: Amount per Adjusted Patient Day
fields.title: Amount per Adjusted Patient Day
